SHORT_DESCR.P: Acquisition of a dilution refrigerator Model CF-CS110-20002PT-Maglev of Leiden Cryogenics bv by means of the negotiated procedure (article 2.32 Dutch Procurement Act 2020).

Acquisition of a dilution refrigerator Model CF-CS110-20002PT-Maglev by Leiden Cryogenics bv for scientific research as this is the only available system that can fulfil the requirements. See the link to the Negometrix website in section I) for the full justification.

D_JUSTIFICATION.P: In the Oosterkamp group at Leiden University we aim to achieve ultralow vibrations at ultralow temperatures in a cryogen free dilution refrigerator for the study of quantum materials using advanced scanning probe microscopes and to study the foundations of quantum mechanics with special purpose experiments. To keep operational costs low we need the dilution refrigerator to be pre-cooled with a closed cycle pulse tube system.

The scanning probe microscopy techniques include scanning tunneling microscopy, atomic force microscopy and magnetic resonance force microscopy. To the best of our knowledge our STM experiments in a closed cycle dilution refrigerator (1) are the first and, so far the only, successful STM measurement with atomic resolution in a dilution refrigerator with the pulse tube on. Our Magnetic resonance force microscopy experiments, an advanced version of an atomic force microscope, requires a force measurement performed with a mechanical resonator, usually with a resonance frequency of 1-10 kHz. Thanks to an advanced vibration isolation system developed in house (2), we have achieved the lowest temperature magnetic resonance force microscopy to date (3).

All these achievements have been realised in systems that were bought from Leiden Cryogenics BV, and were modified at Leiden University, in part through collaboration with Leiden Cryogenics BV and Leiden Spin Imaging BV.

For our upcoming experiments we aim to go a step further. We wish to combine the experiments such as the ones mentioned above with even lower temperatures at the bottom of our vibration isolation system. We have already, with a Leiden Cryogenics PrNi5 nuclear demagnetisation stage, achieved a temperature of 1 mK in the cryogen free system. In the coming years, we would like to achieve temperatures smaller than 1 mK in combination with achieving atomic resolution.
Our budget for this new dilution refrigerator is approximately EUR 500 000.

These experiments at 1mK need a larger cooling power at 3 K (hence two pulse tubes) because of the complexity of the experiments and because of the need for a 2 T magnet and a PrNi5 nuclear demagnetisation stage. Because of the vibration requirements, which we need to equal or surpass the vibration levels reported in (1-3), we would like to announce that we intend to purchase a new cryogen free Leiden Cryogenics dilution refrigerator Model CF-CS110-20002PT-Maglev, as this is the only available system that can fulfil the requirements.

INFO_ADD.P: Representations can be made within 20 days of this publication of our intention to award the contract.

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: Within 20 days of this publication of our intention to award the contract.
